summary: The document is an FBI communication related to the JFK assassination system, focusing on individuals associated with gambling activities in the New Kensington area, particularly Gabriel Mannarino and William Sams. It discusses suspicions around Sams' avoidance of IRS raids, suggesting he may have insider information or is an informant. The FBI plans to leverage this situation for their benefit, either to disrupt the Mannarino racket empire or to gain intelligence from Sams. Both individuals are noted as armed and dangerous.
key_findings: The document is part of the FBI's records related to the JFK assassination system.
It highlights suspicions about William Sams' ability to avoid IRS raids, suggesting possible insider information or his role as an informant.
The FBI intends to use this information to disrupt the Mannarino racket empire or gain intelligence from Sams.
Both subjects, Gabriel Mannarino and William Sams, are considered armed and dangerous.
